title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 150.18 - Directional signs permitted because of substantial economic hardship
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 150.18 - Directional signs permitted because of substantial economic hardship

State Regulations

Subsection (o) of section
131
of title 23, United States

Code, was added by section 122 of the Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1976 to
provide that a state may request an exemption from removal requirements of the

Federal-Aid Highway Beautification Act upon a showing that removal of certain
signs would work a substantial economic hardship within a specific area. The

Department of Transportation will make the application, which is permitted
under this provision, to the United States Department of Transportation and
will permit directional signs to exist in conformance with any approved
exemption which has been granted in conformance with the Federal
statute. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
150.18

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
